intro: Dolichandrone lutea, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its branching stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round, green fruits that contain seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Dolichandrone lutea is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats.
